name: Carrick Lodge Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Guest House is well run and very friendly. The breakfasts are exceptionally nourishing tasty and good quality food. From the breakfast room the view of Goatfell and the bay is outstanding. Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Wonderful atmosphere

reviews.text: I spend three nights in this hotel. Room nr. 4 is beautiful with attached bathroom. The shower is small but ok. WiFi is free and available in the rooms. The breakfast is great and the atmosphere is quiet.
reviews.title: Good place to spend a few days with friendly owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Well located comfortable B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From this place you can go many ways. Brodick is down the hill and there is a bus stop to the other parts of Arran.
reviews.title: Great Hospitality

reviews.text: The owners were away for most of our stay, but their stand-ins were very helpful and friendly. Carrick Lodge was clean, comfortable and quiet and we slept well, Decent breakfasts too. Only saw the owners the night before and morning when we left, but they were also very friendly.
reviews.title: Carrick Lodge is a wonderful place to stay.

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at Carrick lodge, Brodick. The location of the lodge is fantastic only 5 minutes walk from the ferry terminal and the view from our window out over Brodick harbour to goatfell was lovely. The breakfast in the morning was really good, especially the kippers. The only thing was the rooms although comfortable were pretty dated and the shower was really weak. If the rooms were updated this place would be fantastic.
reviews.title: Decent B&B in a good location

reviews.text: My friend and I arrived at the Carrick lodge for 1 nights stay.
reviews.title: Disaster with a happy ending

reviews.text: On arrival we were met by the owner and given our key to our room. Our initial thoughts were that the room was clean and just what we looking for.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: However on going into the bathroom we discovered that the bathroom was old and tired n not a 3*
reviews.title: ok b&b

reviews.text: We would not have bothered it being old, however the bathroom was filthy, the shower screen was mouldy and dirty, some of the tiles were cracked, there was
reviews.title: Welcoming. Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent an overnight to allow us to walk (climb) Goatfell. Lovely place beds comfortable and the whole house was very clean. Breakfast was one of the best I have had. Beautiful views from the sitting area across Brodick Bay to Goatfell. Can not recommend this bed and breakfast highly enough.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at The Carrick Lodge in Brodick & would highly recommend this Guest House to anyone. The owners, Donald & Faith were very welcoming & friendly throughout our visit. Our bedroom was extremely spacious & comfortable & along with the added bonus of lounge facilities, gave our stay a very homely & relaxing feel. There was an excellent choice available at breakfast & I found the quality & variety as good as in any 4* hotel & the views from the dining room overlooking Brodick Bay & Goat Fell were simply breathtaking. The Carrick Lodge is ideally situated just a short walk from the village centre & a stone's throw from the ferry making it the ideal base in which to explore the Isle of Arran.
reviews.title: Fantastic, friendly, comfortable, accommodation.

reviews.text: We are regular visitors to Arran and always stay at Carrick Lodge. The location is excellent - close to ferry and easy walking distance to town and the views from the house are spectacular. We are always made very welcome and the owner can never do enough to help. It is very comfortable and has a very homely feel. We like to do a lot of walking and the breakfasts are amazing - enough to keep you going all day. Highly recommend this guest house.
reviews.title: Absolutly Horrible

aka: Carrick Lodge Guest House Brodick, Isle Of Arran
description: Carrick Lodge is a beautiful sandstone building occupying an elevated position only 450 yards from Brodick Pier. Sitting in its own attractive, mature gardens, Carrick Lodge enjoys enviable views across the bay to Brodick Castle and Goatfell from its spacious lounge and dining room.
